subject: biology
title: Symmetry and Body Plans MCQ Problems

problems.author: Kotryna Mieldažytė
problems.question: Which group of animals lacks any definite symmetry?
problems.hint: Flatworms and roundworms have bilateral symmetry, meaning their bodies can be divided into two mirrored halves.
problems.detailed: Sponges are unique, they do not have a defined body plan/symmetry. Sponges are considered asymmetrical. They have no true tissues or organs either.

problems.author: Kotryna Mieldažytė
problems.question: Radial symmetry is most advantageous for:
problems.hint: Imagine having arms and senses in all directions! What would you be able to do?
problems.detailed: Radial symmetry is advantageous for detecting stimuli from all directions. For example, when feeding, one could reach out in all directions, increasing their chances of capturing food.

problems.author: Kotryna Mieldažytė
problems.question: Which adaptation is most closely associated with bilateral symmetry?
problems.hint: Bilateral and radial are two very different body plans. Option C is qustionable.
problems.detailed: Bilateral symmetry is closely associated with cephalization. Cephalization is the collection of sensory organs and nervous tissue at the front-most portion of the body. It makes sense because the 'control center' is at the front of the body.

problems.author: Kotryna Mieldažytė
problems.question: How many primary germ layers are lacking in diploblastic animals?
problems.hint: The maximum number of layers is 3.
problems.detailed: An organism can either be diploclastic or triploblastic. Diploblastic organisms have only the ectoderm and endoderm (no mesoderm). That means biploblastic aniamsl lack one layer.

problems.author: Kotryna Mieldažytė
problems.question: Which group is triploblastic?
problems.hint: Cnidarians are diploblastic. They only have a ectoderm and endoderm.
problems.detailed: Flatworms are triploblastic, they have an ectoderm, mesoderm, and endoderm.

problems.author: Kotryna Mieldažytė
problems.question: Which germ layer is responsible for forming muscles and circulatory systems?
problems.hint: The blastocoel is a fluid-filled cavity within the blastula, it is not a germ layer.
problems.detailed: The mesoderm is responsible for forming the muscle and circulatory system.

problems.author: Kotryna Mieldažytė
problems.question: What type of body cavity do roundworms (Nematoda) possess?
problems.hint: Acoelomate is the same as having no cavity at all
problems.detailed: Roundworms are pseudocoelomate, meaning they have a partially lined body cavity - not fully lined by mesoderm, unlike a true coelom.

problems.author: Kotryna Mieldažytė
problems.question: Which feature allows organs to grow and move independently of the body wall?
problems.hint: Think of a cavity that separates the internal organs from the cell wall.
problems.detailed: The coelom allows organs to grow independently of the body wall.
